Common Clothes.Effect: If your Main Stat is lower than 2, it counts as 2.
Common Clothes.Description: Common Clothes can range from cheap peasant clothes to expensive, noble or formal clothes. Feel free to customize the way your character looks with Common Clothes!

Robes.Downside: You need at least 2 Intelligence to have the +1 Counter Check Grade.
Robes.Description: Robes vary in purpose and design. They can symbolize a wizard's robes, a priest's apparel or a noble's dress.

Unarmored.Effect: +10 Reserve Health (you must always have been and remain Unarmored to use this 10 Reserve Health)
Unarmored.Description:
No armor or very little clothing, such as a bare chest or lightly clothed body. You rely on your reflexes more than on armor.

Note: You must have been continuously Unarmored since your last Long Rest to use this 10 Reserve Health. If you use any of this Reserve Health, you can no longer wear any other armor type until the next Long Rest (or else you become Exhausted, and remain Exhausted until a Long Rest).

Leather Armor.Description: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil.

Padded Armor.Description: Padded Armor consists of quilted layers of cloth and batting. It's thickness is both a pro and a con, as it absorbs water quickly.
Padded Armor.Downside: Your bonus on all Checks can't be more than 0 while in water (even shallow water).

Hide Armor.Effect: You take only 50% Smash and Force damage and from Falling.
Hide Armor.Description: This crude armor consists of thick furs and pelts. It is commonly worn by Barbarian and other folk who lack access to the tools and materials needed to create better armor. Prone to catching fire.

Splint Armor.Description: This armor is made of narrow vertical strips of metal riveted to a backing of leather that is worn over cloth padding. Flexible Chain Mail protects the joints, yet also puts some strain on them, hence the penalty to reflexes.
Splint Armor.Effect: +1 Movement Speed while at full Health
Splint Armor.Downside: Your Dexterity bonus for Dexterity Combat Checks can't be more than 0.

Chain Mail.Description: Made of interlocking metal rings, Chain Mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows. Noisy, but effective.

Scale Mail.Description: This armor consists of a coat and leggings (and perhaps a separate skirt) of leather covered with overlapping pieces of metal, much like the scales of a fish. Great defense capabilities, though prone to breaking by force.
Scale Mail.Downside: You take 150% Smash and Force damage.

Plate Armor.Description: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body.
Plate Armor.Downside:
Requires at least 2 Might to wear (or else you are Exhausted)
-1 Movement Speed and -5 on all Dexterity Checks
